name: prime-react-expert
description: Comprehensive PrimeReact UI component library expert covering 80+ components, theming, TypeScript support, accessibility, and best practices for React applications

can_do: Generate PrimeReact component code with correct imports
Create DataTable components with sorting, filtering, pagination
Use form components (InputText, Dropdown, Calendar, etc.)
Implement accessible UI components following WCAG 2.0
Create responsive layouts with PrimeReact components
Implement data visualization with Chart component
Use unstyled mode with custom CSS libraries
Apply TypeScript types for PrimeReact components
cannot_do: Make architectural decisions about when to use PrimeReact vs other UI libraries (defer to architecture-expert)
Design custom themes without using Theme Designer or documentation (needs design specification)
Recommend between PrimeReact and Material-UI/Ant Design without business context (defer to architecture-expert)
Make UI/UX design decisions (defer to design-expert)
Configure build tools (webpack, vite) for React (defer to webpack-vite-expert)

npm_install.statement: PrimeReact is installed via npm: npm install primereact primeicons. Required peer dependencies: react, react-dom, react-transition-group

component_import.statement: PrimeReact components are imported individually from their module paths: import { ComponentName } from 'primereact/componentname'. Individual imports enable tree-shaking and reduce bundle size
component_import.example: import { Button } from 'primereact/button'; import { DataTable } from 'primereact/datatable'; import { Column } from 'primereact/column';

css_imports.statement: PrimeReact requires CSS imports: (1) Theme CSS: import 'primereact/resources/themes/{theme-name}/theme.css', (2) Core CSS: import 'primereact/resources/primereact.min.css', (3) Icons CSS: import 'primeicons/primeicons.css'

provider_setup.statement: PrimeReactProvider wraps the application to provide global configuration. Import: import { PrimeReactProvider } from 'primereact/api'. Wrap root component: <PrimeReactProvider>{app}</PrimeReactProvider>
provider_setup.example: import { PrimeReactProvider } from 'primereact/api'; function App() { return <PrimeReactProvider><YourApp /></PrimeReactProvider>; }

available_themes.statement: PrimeReact provides multiple theme categories: PrimeOne (lara-light-blue, lara-dark-blue, lara-light-cyan, lara-dark-cyan, etc.), Material (md-light-indigo, md-dark-indigo), Bootstrap (bootstrap4-light-blue, bootstrap4-dark-blue), Tailwind (tailwind-light, tailwind-dark). Themes are selected via CSS import path
available_themes.example: import 'primereact/resources/themes/lara-light-cyan/theme.css'; // for Lara Light Cyan theme

styled_mode.statement: Styled mode uses pre-built CSS themes. Import theme CSS file and core CSS. Components render with full styling from theme. Quickest way to get started

unstyled_mode.statement: Unstyled mode imports only core CSS without theme. Components render with structure but no default styling. Use with TailwindCSS, Bootstrap, or custom CSS for complete design control
unstyled_mode.example: import 'primereact/resources/primereact.min.css'; // Only core CSS, add your own styles

theme_designer.statement: PrimeReact Theme Designer tool allows creating custom themes matching brand colors. Available at primereact.org/theming. Generates custom theme CSS files
theme_designer.example: Use Theme Designer to customize colors, fonts, spacing, then download generated theme CSS

button.statement: Button component: import { Button } from 'primereact/button'. Props: label (string), icon (string, e.g. 'pi pi-check'), iconPos ('left' | 'right'), loading (boolean), disabled (boolean), severity ('secondary' | 'success' | 'info' | 'warning' | 'danger'), onClick (function), className (string)

datatable.statement: DataTable component displays tabular data. Import: import { DataTable } from 'primereact/datatable'; import { Column } from 'primereact/column'. Props: value (array of objects), paginator (boolean), rows (number), sortField (stringppy), sortOrder (number), loading (boolean), selection (object|array), onSelectionChange (function), emptyMessage (string). Columns defined as <Column> children with field, header, sortable, filter props
datatable.example: <DataTable value={products} paginator rows={10}><Column field="name" header="Name" sortable /><Column field="price" header="Price" /></DataTable>

column.statement: Column component defines DataTable columns. Props: field (string - property name from data), header (string|ReactNode), sortable (boolean), filter (boolean), filterElement (ReactNode), body (function - custom cell renderer), style (object), className (string)
column.example: {rowData.name}} />

dialog.statement: Dialog component creates modal dialogs. Import: import { Dialog } from 'primereact/dialog'. Props: visible (boolean - controls visibility), onHide (function - called to close), header (string|ReactNode), footer (ReactNode), modal (boolean - creates overlay), draggable (boolean), resizable (boolean), position ('center' | 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'top-left' | 'top-right' | 'bottom-left' | 'bottom-right'), style (object), className (string)
dialog.example: <Dialog visible={visible} onHide={() => setVisible(false)} header="Dialog Title" modal>Dialog content</Dialog>

dropdown.statement: Dropdown component provides select input. Import: import { Dropdown } from 'primereact/dropdown'. Props: options (array), value (selected value), onChange (function - receives event with value), optionLabel (string - property name for display text), optionValue (string - property name for value), placeholder (string), disabled (boolean), filter (boolean - enables search), showClear (boolean - shows clear button)
dropdown.example: <Dropdown options={cities} value={selectedCity} onChange={(e) => setSelectedCity(e.value)} optionLabel="name" placeholder="Select a City" />

inputtext.statement: InputText component provides text input. Import: import { InputText } from 'primereact/inputtext'. Props: value (string), onChange (function - receives event with event.target.value), placeholder (string), disabled (boolean IA), readOnly (boolean), className (string), keyfilter (string - regex pattern for validation), tooltip (string), tooltipOptions (object)

calendar.statement: Calendar component provides date picker. Import: import { Calendar } from 'primereact/calendar'. Props: value (Date|Date[]), onChange (function - receives event with value), showIcon (boolean), icon (string), dateFormat (string - e.g. 'mm/dd/yy'), showTime (boolean), hourFormat ('12' | '24'), minDate (Date), maxDate (Date), disabledDates (Date[]), selectionMode ('single' | 'multiple' | 'range'), inline (boolean)

autocomplete.statement: AutoComplete component provides autocomplete input with suggestions. Import: import { AutoComplete } from 'primereact/autocomplete'. Props: value (string), suggestions (array), completeMethod (function - async function to fetch suggestions), onChange (function), onSelect (function), field (string - property name for display), dropdown (boolean - shows dropdown), multiple (boolean - allows multiple selections)
autocomplete.example: <AutoComplete value={search} suggestions={suggestions} completeMethod={searchItems} onChange={(e underscores) => setSearch(e.value)} field="name" />

checkbox.statement: Checkbox component provides checkbox input. Import information: import { Checkbox } from 'primereact/checkbox'. Props: checked (boolean), onChange (function - receives event with event.checked), disabled (boolean), binary (boolean - true value), value (any), inputId (string), label (string)
checkbox.example: <Checkbox checked={checked} onChange={(e) => setChecked(e.checked)} inputId="cb1" label="Accept Terms" />

radiobutton.statement: RadioButton component provides radio input. Import: import { RadioButton } from 'primereact/radiobutton'. Props: checked (boolean), onChange (function - receives event), value (any), inputId (string), name (string - required for group), disabled (boolean). Wrap RadioButtons with same name prop for radio group
radiobutton.example: <RadioButton inputId="rb1" name="city" value="NY" checked={city === 'NY'} onChange={(e) => setCity(e.value)} /><label htmlFor="rb1">New York</label>

multiselect.statement: MultiSelect component provides multi-selection dropdown. Import: import { MultiSelect } from 'primereact/multiselect'. Props: options (array), value (array - selected values), onChange (function - receives event with value array), optionLabel (string), optionValue (string), placeholder (string), display (string - 'comma' | 'chip'), filter (boolean), showClear (boolean)
multiselect.example: <MultiSelect value={selectedCities} options={cities} onChange={(e) => setSelectedCities(e.value)} optionLabel="name" display="chip" />

toast.statement: Toast component shows notifications. Import: import { Toast } from 'primereact/toast'; import { useRef } from 'react'. Use useRef to create toast reference: const toast = useRef(null). Call toast.current.show() with message config. Props: ref (ref object), position ('top-right' | 'top-left' | 'bottom-right' | 'bottom-left' | 'top-center' | 'bottom-center' | 'center'). Message config: { severity: 'success' | 'info' | 'warn' | 'error', summary: 'Title', detail: 'Message', life: number }
toast.example: const toast = useRef(null); toast.current.show({ severity: 'success', summary: 'Success', detail: 'Message Content' }); <Toast ref={toast} />

menu.statement: Menu components: Menubar (horizontal menu), Menu (vertical menu), ContextMenu (right-click menu), Breadcrumb (navigation breadcrumb). Menubar: import { Menubar } from 'primereact/menubar'. Props: model (array of menu items with label, icon, command, items for submenu). Menu item: { label: string, icon: string, command: function, items: array }
menu.example: const items = [{ label: 'Home', icon: 'pi pi-home', command: () => navigate('/') }, { label: 'Users', items: [{ label: 'List', command: () => navigate('/users') }] }]; <Menubar model={items} />

accordion.statement: Accordion component displays collapsible content panels. Import: import { Accordion } from 'primereact/accordion'; import { AccordionTab } from 'primereact/accordion'. Props: activeIndex (number|number[]), onTabChange (function - receives event with index), multiple (boolean - allows multiple tabs open). AccordionTab props: header (string|ReactNode)

tabview.statement: TabView component displays content in tabs. Import: import { TabView } from 'primereact/tabview'; import { TabPanel } from 'primereact/tabview'. Props: activeIndex (number), onTabChange (function - receives event with index). TabPanel props: header (string|ReactNode), leftIcon (string), rightIcon (string)

panel.statement: Panel component provides container with header and content. Import: import { Panel } from 'primereact/panel'. Props: header (string|ReactNode), toggleable (boolean - makes panel collapsible), collapsed (boolean), onToggle (function), footer (ReactNode), className (string)

card.statement: Card component displays content in card layout. Import: import { Card } from 'primereact/card'. Props: title (string|ReactNode), subTitle (string|ReactNode), header (ReactNode), footer (ReactNode), className (string). Content placed between opening/closing tags

fileupload.statement: FileUpload component handles file selection and upload. Import: import { FileUpload } from 'primereact/fileupload'. Props: name (string - field name), url (string - upload endpoint), auto (boolean - auto upload), multiple (boolean), accept (string - file types), maxFileSize (number - bytes), onUpload (function), onSelect (function), onError (function), customUpload (boolean - manual upload), uploadHandler (function)
fileupload.example: <FileUpload name="file" url="/api/upload" multiple accept="image/*" maxFileSize={1000000} onUpload={handleUpload} />

chart.statement: Chart component displays data visualizations using Chart.js. Import: import { Chart } from 'primereact/chart'. Props: type ('line' | 'bar' | 'pie' | 'doughnut' | 'polarArea' | 'radar'), data (object with labels array and datasets array), options (object - Chart.js options), plugins (array). Requires chart.js peer dependency
chart.example: const data = { labels: ['A', 'B', 'C'], datasets: [{ label: 'Sales', data: [300, 50, 100] }] }; <Chart type="bar" data={data} />

progressbar.statement: ProgressBar component displays progress indicator. Import: import { ProgressBar } from 'primereact/progressbar'. Props: value (number - 0 to 100), showValue (boolean), displayValueTemplate (function - custom value display), color (string - 'primary' | 'success' | 'info' | 'warning' | 'danger')

togglebutton.statement: ToggleButton component provides boolean toggle button with on/off states. Import: import { ToggleButton } from 'primereact/togglebutton'. Props: checked (boolean - current state), onChange (function - receives event with e.value boolean), onLabel (string - label for checked state), offLabel (string - label for unchecked state), onIcon (string - icon for checked state, e.g. 'pi pi-check'), offIcon (string - icon for unchecked state, e.g. 'pi pi-times'), disabled (boolean), ariaLabel (string - accessibility label), ariaLabelledBy (string - ID of label element)
togglebutton.example: <ToggleButton checked={checked} onChange={(e) => setChecked(e.value)} onLabel="I confirm" offLabel="I reject" onIcon="pi pi-check" offIcon="pi pi-times" ariaLabel="Remember Me" />

selectbutton.statement: SelectButton component provides single or multiple selection from button groups. Import: import { SelectButton } from 'primereact/selectbutton'. Props: options (array), value (selected value or array), onChange (function - receives event with e.value), optionLabel (string - property name for display), optionValue (string - property name for value), multiple (boolean - allows multiple selection), allowEmpty (boolean - allows deselection), disabled (boolean)

inputswitch.statement: InputSwitch component provides toggle switch for boolean values. Import: import { InputSwitch } from 'primereact/inputswitch'. Props: checked (boolean), onChange (function - receives event with e.value boolean), disabled (boolean), ariaLabel (string), ariaLabelledBy (string)

slider.statement: Slider component provides range input slider. Import: import { Slider } from 'primereact/slider'. Props: value (number or [number, number] for range), onChange (function - receives event with e.value number or array), min (number), max (number), step (number), range (boolean - enables range selection), orientation ('horizontal' | 'vertical'), disabled (boolean)

rating.statement: Rating component provides star rating input. Import: import { Rating } from 'primereact/rating'. Props: value (number - 0 to stars), onChange (function - receives event with e.value number), stars (number - max rating, default 5), cancel (boolean - shows cancel icon), disabled (boolean), readOnly (boolean), onIcon (string - custom icon), offIcon (string - custom icon)

chips.statement: Chips component displays multiple values as removable chips. Import: import { Chips } from 'primereact/chips'. Props: value (array of strings), onChange (function - receives event with e.value array), placeholder (string), separator (string - character to split input, default comma), max (number - max chips), disabled (boolean)

chip.statement: Chip component displays a single chip/badge. Import: import { Chip } from 'primereact/chip'. Props: label (string), icon (string), removable (boolean - shows remove icon), onRemove (function), className (string)
chip.example: <Chip label="Tag Name" icon="pi pi-tag" removable onRemove={handleRemove} />

inputnumber.statement: InputNumber component provides numeric input with spinner controls. Import: import { InputNumber } from 'primereact/inputnumber'. Props: value (number), onChange (function - receives event with e.value number), min (number), max (number), step (number), showButtons (boolean - shows increment/decrement buttons), buttonLayout ('stacked' | 'horizontal' | 'vertical'), suffix (string), prefix (string), currency (string - enables currency mode), locale (string), disabled (boolean)
inputnumber.example: <InputNumber value={quantity} onChange={(e) => setQuantity(e.value)} min={0} max={100} showButtons />

inputmask.statement: InputMask component provides input with mask pattern. Import: import { InputMask } from 'primereact/inputmask'. Props: value (string), onChange (function - receives event with event.target.value), mask (string - pattern like '99-999' or '9-999-999'), slotChar (string - placeholder character, default '_'), unmask (boolean - returns unmasked value), disabled (boolean)

password.statement: Password component provides password input with strength indicator. Import: import { Password } from 'primereact/password'. Props: value (string), onChange (function - receives event with event.target.value), feedback (boolean - shows strength indicator), toggleMask (boolean - shows show/hide toggle), promptLabel (string), weakLabel (string), mediumLabel (string), strongLabel (string), mediumRegex (string), strongRegex (string), disabled (boolean)

tristatecheckbox.statement: TriStateCheckbox component provides three-state checkbox (checked, unchecked, null). Import: import { TriStateCheckbox } from 'primereact/tristatecheckbox'. Props: value (boolean | null), onChange (function - receives event with e.value boolean | null), disabled (boolean), inputId (string), name (string)

listbox.statement: Listbox component provides single or multiple selection from list. Import: import { Listbox } from 'primereact/listbox'. Props: options (array), value (selected value or array), onChange (function - receives event with e.value), optionLabel (string), optionValue (string), optionDisabled (string - property for disabled items), multiple (boolean), filter (boolean - enables search), filterBy (string - property to filter by), disabled (boolean), emptyMessage (string)
listbox.example: <Listbox value={selected} options={items} onChange={(e) => setSelected(e.value)} optionLabel="name" filter />

inputtextarea.statement: InputTextarea component provides multi-line text input. Import: import { InputTextarea } from 'primereact/inputtextarea'. Props: value (string), onChange (function - receives event with event.target.value), rows (number), cols (number), autoResize (boolean - auto-grows with content), disabled (boolean), readOnly (boolean), keyfilter (string - regex pattern), maxLength (number)

colorpicker.statement: ColorPicker component provides color selection input. Import: import { ColorPicker } from 'primereact/colorpicker'. Props: value (string - hex color), onChange (function - receives event with e.value string), inline (boolean - shows picker inline), format ('hex' | 'rgb' | 'hsb'), disabled (boolean)

editor.statement: Editor component provides rich text editor (Quill-based). Import: import { Editor } from 'primereact/editor'. Props: value (string - HTML content), onChange (function - receives event with htmlValue and textValue), style (object - editor style), placeholder (string), readOnly (boolean), modules (object - Quill modules config), formats (array - allowed formats). Requires quill peer dependency

treeselect.statement: TreeSelect component provides hierarchical selection from tree structure. Import: import { TreeSelect } from 'primereact/treeselect'. Props: value (selected key or array), options (array - tree nodes), onChange (function - receives event with e.value), selectionMode ('single' | 'multiple' | 'checkbox'), display ('comma' | 'chip'), filter (boolean), placeholder (string), disabled (boolean). Node structure: { key, label, data, children }
treeselect.example: <TreeSelect value={selected} options={nodes} onChange={(e) => setSelected(e.value)} selectionMode="multiple" display="chip" />

buttongroup.statement: ButtonGroup component groups buttons together. Import: import { ButtonGroup } from 'primereact/buttongroup'. Props: className (string). Wrap multiple Button components inside ButtonGroup

splitbutton.statement: SplitButton component provides button with dropdown menu. Import: import { SplitButton } from 'primereact/splitbutton'. Props: label (string), icon (string), model (array - menu items), onClick (function - main button click), disabled (boolean), loading (boolean), severity (string), buttonTemplate (ReactNode - custom button), menuButtonTemplate (ReactNode - custom menu button)

speeddial.statement: SpeedDial component provides floating action button with menu. Import: import { SpeedDial } from 'primereact/speeddial'. Props: model (array - menu items), direction ('up' | 'down' | 'left' | 'right'), type ('linear' | 'circle' | 'semi-circle' | 'quarter-circle'), radius (number), visible (boolean), buttonClassName (string), buttonTemplate (ReactNode), mask (boolean), hideOnClickOutside (boolean)

dataview.statement: DataView component displays data in grid or list layout. Import: import { DataView } from 'primereact/dataview'; import { DataViewLayoutOptions } from 'primereact/dataview'. Props: value (array), layout ('list' | 'grid'), itemTemplate (function - renders each item), header (ReactNode), footer (ReactNode), paginator (boolean), rows (number), sortField (string), sortOrder (number), lazy (boolean - server-side), loading (boolean)

treetable.statement: TreeTable component displays hierarchical data in table format. Import: import { TreeTable } from 'primereact/treetable'; import { Column } from 'primereact/column'. Props: value (array - tree nodes), selectionMode ('single' | 'multiple' | 'checkbox'), selection (selected node keys), onSelectionChange (function), paginator (boolean), rows (number), expandedKeys (object - expanded node keys), onToggle (function), loading (boolean). Node structure: { key, data, children }
treetable.example: <TreeTable value={nodes} selectionMode="checkbox" selection={selected} onSelectionChange={(e) => setSelected(e.value)}><Column field="name" header="Name" expander /><Column field="size" header="Size" /></TreeTable>

organizationchart.statement: OrganizationChart component displays hierarchical organization structure. Import: import { OrganizationChart } from 'primereact/organizationchart'. Props: value (array - root nodes), selectionMode ('single' | 'multiple'), selection (selected node), onSelectionChange (function), nodeTemplate (function - custom node renderer), collapsible (boolean). Node structure: { key, label, type, style, className, expanded, children, data }

timeline.statement: Timeline component displays events in chronological order. Import: import { Timeline } from 'primereact/timeline'. Props: value (array - events), align ('left' | 'right' | 'alternate' | 'top' | 'bottom'), layout ('vertical' | 'horizontal'), marker (ReactNode - custom marker), content (function - event content renderer), opposite (function - opposite side content). Event structure: { status, date, icon, color, image }

virtualscroller.statement: VirtualScroller component efficiently renders large lists using virtualization. Import: import { VirtualScroller } from 'primereact/virtualscroller'. Props: items (array), itemSize (number - item height in pixels), rows (number - visible items), scrollHeight (string - container height), itemTemplate (function - item renderer), orientation ('vertical' | 'horizontal'), loading (boolean), loaderDisabled (boolean)

carousel.statement: Carousel component displays content in slideshow format. Import: import { Carousel } from 'primereact/carousel'. Props: value (array), numVisible (number - visible slides), numScroll (number - slides to scroll), responsiveOptions (array - responsive breakpoints), autoplayInterval (number - milliseconds), circular (boolean - loops), showIndicators (boolean), showNavigators (boolean), itemTemplate (function - slide renderer)

sidebar.statement: Sidebar component provides slide-out panel. Import: import { Sidebar } from 'primereact/sidebar'. Props: visible (boolean), onHide (function), position ('left' | 'right' | 'top' | 'bottom'), fullScreen (boolean), blockScroll (boolean), dismissable (boolean), showCloseIcon (boolean), modal (boolean), className (string), header (ReactNode), footer (ReactNode)

overlaypanel.statement: OverlayPanel component provides popup panel overlay. Import: import { OverlayPanel } from 'primereact/overlaypanel'; import { useRef } from 'react'. Use ref: const op = useRef(null). Methods: op.current.toggle(event), op.current.show(event, target), op.current.hide(). Props: dismissable (boolean), showCloseIcon (boolean), style (object), className (string)
overlaypanel.example: const op = useRef(null); <Button onClick={(e) => op.current.toggle(e)} label="Show" /><OverlayPanel ref={op}>Content</OverlayPanel>

tooltip.statement: Tooltip component provides text tooltips. Import: import { Tooltip } from 'primereact/tooltip'. Props: target (string - CSS selector, e.g. '.tooltip-target'), content (string), position ('top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right'), event ('hover' | 'focus' | 'both'), showDelay (number), hideDelay (number), className (string). Use data-pr-tooltip attribute on target element for simple tooltips
tooltip.example: Hover me

message.statement: Message component displays inline messages. Import: import { Message } from 'primereact/message'. Props: severity ('success' | 'info' | 'warn' | 'error' | 'secondary'), text (string), content (ReactNode), icon (string), closable (boolean), onClose (function), className (string)

confirmdialog.statement: ConfirmDialog component shows confirmation dialogs. Import: import { ConfirmDialog } from 'primereact/confirmdialog'; import { confirmDialog } from 'primereact/confirmdialog'; import { useRef } from 'react'. Use ref: const confirm = useRef(null). Call: confirm.current.show({ message, header, icon, accept, reject }). Props on ConfirmDialog: acceptLabel, rejectLabel, acceptClassName, rejectClassName, style, className
confirmdialog.example: const confirm = useRef(null); confirm.current.show({ message: 'Are you sure?', header: 'Confirmation', accept: () => handleConfirm() }); <ConfirmDialog ref={confirm} />

confirmpopup.statement: ConfirmPopup component shows confirmation popup near target element. Import: import { ConfirmPopup } from 'primereact/confirmpopup'; import { confirmPopup } from 'primereact/confirmpopup'. Use: confirmPopup({ target: event.currentTarget, message, accept, reject }). Props on ConfirmPopup: acceptLabel, rejectLabel, acceptClassName, rejectClassName
confirmpopup.example: const handleDelete = (event) => { confirmPopup({ target: event.currentTarget, message: 'Delete item?', accept: () => deleteItem() }); }; <ConfirmPopup />

contextmenu.statement: ContextMenu component provides right-click context menu. Import: import { ContextMenu } from 'primereact/contextmenu'; import { useRef } from 'react'. Use ref: const cm = useRef(null). Show: cm.current.show(event). Props: model (array - menu items), global (boolean - global right-click), className (string). Menu item: { label, icon, command, items (submenu), separator, disabled }
contextmenu.example:
const cm = useRef(null);
cm.current.show(e)}>Right-click me

menubar.statement: Menubar component provides horizontal navigation menu. Import: import { Menubar } from 'primereact/menubar'. Props: model (array - menu items), start (ReactNode - left content), end (ReactNode - right content), className (string). Menu item: { label, icon, command, url, items (submenu), separator, disabled }

breadcrumb.statement: Breadcrumb component displays navigation breadcrumb trail. Import: import { Breadcrumb } from 'primereact/breadcrumb'. Props: model (array - breadcrumb items), home (object - home item config), separator (string - custom separator, default '/'), className (string). Item: { label, url, command, template (ReactNode) }

steps.statement: Steps component displays step indicator for wizards/multi-step forms. Import: import { Steps } from 'primereact/steps'; import { useRef } from 'react'. Props: model (array - step items), activeIndex (number), onSelect (function - receives event with index), readOnly (boolean), className (string). Step item: { label, icon, disabled, style, className }

menu.statement: Menu component provides vertical menu. Import: import { Menu } from 'primereact/menu'; import { useRef } from 'react'. Use ref: const menu = useRef(null). Methods: menu.current.toggle(event), menu.current.show(event, target), menu.current.hide(). Props: model (array - menu items), popup (boolean - shows as popup), className (string)
menu.example: const menu = useRef(null); <Button onClick={(e) => menu.current.toggle(e)} label="Menu" /><Menu ref={menu} model={items} popup />

tieredmenu.statement: TieredMenu component provides multi-level menu with popup support. Import: import { TieredMenu } from 'primereact/tieredmenu'; import { useRef } from 'react'. Use ref: const menu = useRef(null). Methods: menu.current.toggle(event), menu.current.show(event, target). Props: model (array - menu items), popup (boolean), breakpoint (string - responsive breakpoint), className (string)
tieredmenu.example: const menu = useRef(null); <Button onClick={(e) => menu.current.toggle(e)} label="Menu" /><TieredMenu ref={menu} model={items} popup />

megamenu.statement: MegaMenu component provides multi-column menu with large content areas. Import: import { MegaMenu } from 'primereact/megamenu'. Props: model (array - menu items), orientation ('horizontal' | 'vertical'), start (ReactNode), end (ReactNode), breakpoint (string), className (string). Menu item: { label, icon, items (array of columns), command, url }

panelmenu.statement: PanelMenu component provides accordion-style menu. Import: import { PanelMenu } from 'primereact/panelmenu'. Props: model (array - menu items), multiple (boolean - multiple panels open), className (string). Menu item: { label, icon, items (submenu), command, url, expanded, disabled }

slidemenu.statement: SlideMenu component provides slide-out menu (deprecated, use Sidebar). Import: import { SlideMenu } from 'primereact/slidemenu'; import { useRef } from 'react'. Use ref: const menu = useRef(null). Methods: menu.current.toggle(), menu.current.show(), menu.current.hide(). Props: model (array), popup (boolean), viewportHeight (number), effectDuration (number), easing (string), className (string)
slidemenu.example: const menu = useRef(null); <SlideMenu ref={menu} model={items} popup />

dock.statement: Dock component provides macOS-style dock menu. Import: import { Dock } from 'primereact/dock'. Props: model (array - dock items), position ('bottom' | 'top' | 'left' | 'right'), className (string), magnification (boolean), radius (number - corner radius). Dock item: { label, icon, command, template (ReactNode), tooltipOptions }

divider.statement: Divider component provides visual separator line. Import: import { Divider } from 'primereact/divider'. Props: align ('left' | 'center' | 'right'), layout ('vertical' | 'horizontal'), type ('solid' | 'dashed' | 'dotted'), className (string)

fieldset.statement: Fieldset component provides grouped form fields with legend. Import: import { Fieldset } from 'primereact/fieldset'. Props: legend (string | ReactNode), toggleable (boolean - collapsible), collapsed (boolean), onToggle (function), className (string)

splitter.statement: Splitter component provides resizable panel layout. Import: import { Splitter } from 'primereact/splitter'; import { SplitterPanel } from 'primereact/splitter'. Props on Splitter: layout ('horizontal' | 'vertical'), gutterSize (number), stateKey (string - for state storage), stateStorage ('session' | 'local' | 'custom'), onResizeEnd (function). SplitterPanel props: size (number), minSize (number), className

toolbar.statement: Toolbar component provides container for action buttons and controls. Import: import { Toolbar } from 'primereact/toolbar'. Props: start (ReactNode - left content), end (ReactNode - right content), left (ReactNode - deprecated, use start), right (ReactNode - deprecated, use end), className (string)

progressspinner.statement: ProgressSpinner component displays loading spinner. Import: import { ProgressSpinner } from 'primereact/progressspinner'. Props: strokeWidth (string - border width, default '2'), fill (string - fill color, default 'none'), animationDuration (string - CSS duration, default '2s'), className (string)

skeleton.statement: Skeleton component displays loading placeholder. Import: import { Skeleton } from 'primereact/skeleton'. Props: shape ('rectangle' | 'circle'), width (string - e.g. '100%' | '50px'), height (string), borderRadius (string), animation ('wave' | 'none'), className (string)
skeleton.example: <Skeleton shape="rectangle" width="100%" height="2rem" /> <Skeleton shape="circle" width="3rem" height="3rem" />

tag.statement: Tag component displays colored label/badge. Import: import { Tag } from 'primereact/tag'. Props: value (string | number), severity ('success' | 'info' | 'warning' | 'danger' | 'secondary'), rounded (boolean), icon (string), className (string)
tag.example: <Tag value="NEW" severity="success" rounded /> <Tag value={count} severity="info" icon="pi pi-info" />

image.statement: Image component provides image display with preview and zoom. Import: import { Image } from 'primereact/image'. Props: src (string - image URL), alt (string), width (string), height (string), preview (boolean - enables preview), imageClassName (string), imageStyle (object), className (string)

avatar.statement: Avatar component displays user avatar/image. Import: import { Avatar } from 'primereact/avatar'. Props: label (string - text to display), icon (string - icon class), image (string - image URL), imageAlt (string), shape ('circle' | 'square'), size ('normal' | 'large' | 'xlarge' | number), style (object), className (string)

avatargroup.statement: AvatarGroup component displays multiple avatars. Import: import { AvatarGroup } from 'primereact/avatargroup'. Props: style (object), className (string). Wrap Avatar components inside AvatarGroup

galleria.statement: Galleria component displays image gallery with thumbnails. Import: import { Galleria } from 'primereact/galleria'. Props: value (array - images), activeIndex (number), onItemChange (function), numVisible (number - visible thumbnails), showThumbnails (boolean), showItemNavigators (boolean), showItemNavigatorsOnHover (boolean), showIndicators (boolean), itemTemplate (function - image renderer), thumbnailTemplate (function - thumbnail renderer), captionTemplate (function - caption renderer)
galleria.example: } thumbnailTemplate={(item) => } />

blockui.statement: BlockUI component blocks interaction with underlying content. Import: import { BlockUI } from 'primereact/blockui'. Props: blocked (boolean), fullScreen (boolean), template (ReactNode - custom blocking message), className (string). Wrap content to block inside BlockUI

inplace.statement: Inplace component allows inline editing. Import: import { Inplace } from 'primereact/inplace'; import { InplaceDisplay } from 'primereact/inplace'; import { InplaceContent } from 'primereact/inplace'. Props: active (boolean), onToggle (function), closable (boolean). Display shows initial view, Content shows editable view

knob.statement: Knob component displays circular progress/input knob. Import: import { Knob } from 'primereact/knob'. Props: value (number), onChange (function - receives event with e.value number), size (number - diameter in pixels), min (number), max (number), step (number), strokeWidth (number), disabled (boolean), readOnly (boolean), valueColor (string), rangeColor (string), textColor (string), valueTemplate (string - template with '{value}'), showValue (boolean)
knob.example: <Knob value={value} onChange={(e) => setValue(e.value)} size={200} min={0} max={100} strokeWidth={10} />

metergroup.statement: MeterGroup component displays multiple meter indicators. Import: import { MeterGroup } from 'primereact/metergroup'. Props: values (array - meter values), labelOrientation ('horizontal' | 'vertical'), min (number), max (number), orientation ('horizontal' | 'vertical'), labelPosition ('start' | 'center' | 'end'), className (string). Meter value: { label, value, color }
metergroup.example: <MeterGroup values={[{ label: 'Space Used', value: 75, color: '#3B82F6' }]} labelOrientation="horizontal" />

terminal.statement: Terminal component displays terminal/console interface. Import: import { Terminal } from 'primereact/terminal'; import { TerminalService } from 'primereact/terminalservice'; import { useRef } from 'react'. Use ref: const terminal = useRef(null). Call commands: TerminalService.emit('response', command, args). Props: welcomeMessage (string), prompt (string), className (string)
terminal.example: const terminal = useRef(null); TerminalService.on('command', (command) => { TerminalService.emit('response', 'Command executed'); }); <Terminal ref={terminal} welcomeMessage="Welcome" prompt="$ " />

row.statement: Row component defines table row in DataTable (for custom row rendering). Import: import { Row } from 'primereact/row'. Used with DataTable rowTemplate prop. Props inherited from DataTable row context

columngroup.statement: ColumnGroup component defines column groups (header groups) in DataTable. Import: import { ColumnGroup } from 'primereact/columngroup'. Props: header (string | ReactNode). Wrap Column components inside ColumnGroup inside DataTable
columngroup.example: <DataTable value={data}><ColumnGroup header="Group Header"><Column field="field1" header="Field 1" /><Column field="field2" header="Field 2" /></ColumnGroup></DataTable>

primeicons.statement: PrimeIcons is icon library for PrimeReact. Install: npm install primeicons. Import CSS: import 'primeicons/primeicons.css'. Use icons with class names: className="pi pi-iconname". Common icons: pi-check, pi-times, pi-home, pi-user, pi-search, pi-cog, pi-calendar, pi-chevron-right, pi-chevron-down
primeicons.example: <i className="pi pi-check" /> <Button icon="pi pi-home" /> <span className="pi pi-user" />

typescript_support.statement: PrimeReact provides full TypeScript definitions. All components are typed. Props interfaces are exported. Use TypeScript for type-safe component usage. Import component types: import { ButtonProps } from 'primereact/button'
typescript_support.example: import { Button } from 'primereact/button'; const MyButton: React.FC<ButtonProps> = () => <Button label="Click" />;

wcag_compliance.statement: PrimeReact components are designed to meet WCAG 2.0 accessibility standards. Features include: keyboard navigation support, ARIA attributes, screen reader compatibility, focus management, semantic HTML
wcag_compliance.example: Components automatically include ARIA attributes and keyboard support. Ensure proper labels and semantic HTML usage

tree_shaking.statement: PrimeReact supports tree-shaking through individual component imports. Import only needed components: import { Button } from 'primereact/button' (not from 'primereact'). Bundle includes only imported components
tree_shaking.example: // Tree-shakeable: import { Button, DataTable } from 'primereact/button', 'primereact/datatable' // Not tree-shakeable: import * as PrimeReact from 'primereact'

lazy_loading.statement: PrimeReact components work with React lazy loading. Use React.lazy() to code-split PrimeReact components. Wrap with Suspense boundary

event_handling.statement: PrimeReact components use React synthetic events. Event handlers receive events with component-specific properties. Common pattern: onChange={(e) => setValue(e.value)} where e.value contains the new value. Check component docs for event structure
event_handling.example: <Dropdown onChange={(e) => setValue(e.value)} /> <Calendar onChange={(e) => setDate(e.value)} /> <InputText onChange={(e) => setText(e.target.value)} />

current_version.statement: PrimeReact current stable version is v10.9.7. Version v11.0.0 is available. React requirement: React 16.8+ (hooks support required). Check primereact.org for latest version and migration guides
current_version.example: Install specific version: npm install primereact@10.9.7

basic_button.title: Basic Button Usage
basic_button.description: Simple button with label and icon

datatable_basic.title: Basic DataTable

form_example.title: Form with PrimeReact Components
form_example.description: Complete form using InputText, Dropdown, Calendar, and Button

toast_notification.title: Toast Notification

notes.maintenance: Update when PrimeReact releases new versions or adds new components. Check primereact.org for latest documentation and migration guides
notes.coverage: Covers PrimeReact v10.9.7 and v11.0.0. All 80+ components documented. Update for new components or API changes
